preCondition: A Z44 query has been submitted to the Immunization Registry and a Z42 response is provided back to the EMR.and  the response is available in the EMR for reconciliation and import.
postCondition: Evaluated Immunization History returned from the registry is reconciled and imported into the patient record (Juana Mariana Gonzales)
testObjectives: Request/Receive Patient Immunization Data and Identify Source: The EHR or other clinical software is able to store immunization history accepted electronically from other sources (such as a public health immunization registry consistent with HL7 version 2.5.1, Implementation Guide for Immunization Messaging Release 1.5) or communicated by the patient and manually entered by the clinician. When viewing such information, the provider can determine which immunizations were administered by the practice, which were entered manually as patient-reported, and which were accepted electronically from the public health registry.
evaluationCriteria:
1. The user imports returned vaccinations as follows:
a. Vaccinations NOT imported:
hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage (CVX 08)  administered 1/15/2010
measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine (CVX 94) administered 11/22/2012
VERIFY that the dose validity is marked as invalid

hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage (CVX 08)  administered 10/30/2010
